body: LEAD: Arminius N. Hayne, a musician who was believed to have been the oldest member of Local 802 of the American Federation of Musicians, died of heart disease last Thursday in Brooklyn Hospital. title: Arminius N. Hayne, Musician, 102,

body: LEAD: The shortage of low-cost housing in New York is acute, everyone agrees, and there is a fair amount of money available from city and state agencies and from private groups to help rebuild decaying houses for the homeless and for those unable to pay market rents. body: LEAD: Eight months after New York City officials sought to tear it down, the Vendome, a distinguished but ravaged old apartment house in Brooklyn, yesterday was awarded a $225,000 grant from New York State to help in its reconstruction. body: LEAD: For the last 20 years of his life, Lewis H. Latimer, a black inventor and major pioneer in the development of electric lighting, lived in a comfortable two-and-a-half-story frame house in Flushing, Queens. body: LEAD: March is observed as Women's History Month across the nation. In New York City, it is a time for examining women's lives and celebrating their experiences in events throughout the five boroughs. Many of the events are free. Some are open to women only. The range is wide, in entertainment alone this weekend, from reggae music to Bach and from
title: Women's History Month Celebrated

body: LEAD: The Koch administration has temporarily shelved its plan to demolish a historic, but derelict, apartment house in Brooklyn. Instead, it has offered what amounts to a challenge grant to encourage preservation of the city-owned building.
